short_summary: Construction of new building for storage equipment
description: Construction of a new building for storage equipment at Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) at Nashlyn Pasture Site.
duration_in_months: The expected contract duration is from 2023-07-03 to 2024-03-31.
full_summary:
### Invitation to Qualify for the Nashlyn Pasture Storage Equipment Shop Project

### Project Overview

The Government of Canada is seeking contractors to construct a new storage equipment shop at the Nashlyn Pasture Site in Saskatchewan. The project involves the construction of a 16.46m x 21.95m building with an eave height of 4.87m, incorporating a shop area, kitchen/office, washroom, mechanical/electrical room, and storage mezzanine.

### PIllar Project Scope
The following building systems will be provided by the contractor:

- Metal clad insulated double pitched roof system
- Metal clad insulated exterior wall systems
- Overhead doors
- Walk-in doors
- Storage mezzanine
- Windows
- HVAC Systems
- Plumbing
- Electrical
- Site Services
- Propane tank

### Estimated Value and Documents Submission
The project is estimated to cost between $450,000 and $650,000 (excluding taxes). The project documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Two-Phase Selection Process
A two-phase selection process will be used. Phase 1 involves the evaluation of all bidders' qualifications, and Phase 2 will invite qualified bidders to provide a financial bid on the project.

### Solicitation Information

* Solicitation number: 5000070097R
* Publication date: 2023-05-29
* Tender closing date: 2023-06-23
* Contracting entity: Environment and Climate Change Canada

### Contact Information
For further information, please contact Shawn Davis, Procurement Specialist, at (873) 500-0215 or [shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca](mailto:shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca).

### Document Downloads
To access the tender notice, please visit [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca). The attached documents are available in English and French.

### Trade Agreements
The project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
